title: Ping/Lag issues cant re-route
body:
Team,

Just got back into LoL, and after a few games ran into an issue i ran into in the past; Internet is fine (8d/3u, slow but works for everything i do), but after a few games, only in LoL, my latency is ~250ms causing a half second delay or so.  

I did all the basic checks (Cycled my router, ran speedtest-net, pinged random sites, all check out fine)

I found a post this morning that listed the IP address of LoL's router, servers, etc, and i found the issue.  My traffic is being routed along a path that has 3 ALTER.NET hops, each between 150-300ms. People saying this is Verizons Fios network, but regardless, i tried the following fixes.

1. Tried using googles DNS, flushed dns, repinged, still routed me through this high latency path
2. Tried blocking the IP addresses in firewall outgoing, ended up not being able to reach the servers.
3. Tried WTFast software; worked for a bit, then after 3 games back to 250ms
4. Heard some good things ab KillPing, but also some fishy posts by their devs, so did not ourchase as of writing this.

Any known way to fix this routing issue?  Also, can you list the IP addresses users access so i can continue troubleshooting (Cant find that post!)

Thanks,

-Steve

I have been getting strange lag and high ping spikes, and I think that I have a similar issue... I have also tried these, and others, but I am still getting around 100 ms to 300+ ms in game, when I was getting around 70 ms. Furthermore, no one seems to have any more information that helps.

I'm glad to see you took some great steps to troubleshoot this issue so far. To get a better understanding of exactly where this issue is occurring, I'd like you to run a traceroute to our test IP. First, grab the network app [**WinMTR**](http://winmtr.net/). After booting up the app, plug **104.160.131.1** into the host field before starting the trace. After 5 minutes has gone by, export your results as text and paste them in a reply.

Let me know if you run into issues.
